intro: Hedyotis centranthoides f. glomerata, commonly known as the clustered dotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird species.
